critique: The document is an executive order regarding the Cotton Garment Industry. The primary goal is to ensure fair competition and address concerns within the industry. The tone is formal and authoritative, aiming to convey a sense of order and resolution. The order seeks to address protests and investigate various aspects of the industry, including competition from prison labor and sheltered workshops. The President wants to convey a sense of control and fairness, addressing concerns and ensuring the industry operates smoothly. The language is legalistic and precise, reflecting the nature of an executive order. The context is the National Industrial Recovery Act, suggesting an effort to stabilize and regulate the industry during a time of economic recovery.
